I wasn't sure how I was going to like Portal 2 after enjoying the feel of Portal 1, but I absolutely loved every second of Portal 2. I really thought having GLaDOS and Wheatly following me through the entirety of the game was a great addition. I hope they make another Portal game because these two games have been really fun to play.

Solid game, solid story, solid puzzles.

Love the game, it is such a great story along with everything about the game. I love how you can play with other people in a multiplayer setting. I can't recommend this game enough.
Loved the game, the puzzeles are amazing, and the story is superb.

Normally, I hate puzzle based games, but this is pretty dang fun. The graphics are good for the most part, although you will get some texture popins at times. The sound design is solid. The voice acting is tremendous (although the programmers could've timed some of the interactions better). The game is really funny as well and I had to pause a few times towards the end to catch my breath. The puzzles themselves are pretty interesting and not frustrating. Rather than rely on platforming and precise aiming (which I normally hate), the game pretty much makes you think the entire time to progress. You won't have to think too hard though luckily. I only got stuck a couple of times throuh the 4-10 hour campaign (took me roughly 6 hours) and there are plenty of detailed guides to help you. The multiplayer is pretty fun and surprisingly memorable. The fact there are so many additional levels made by the community is just a testament to how replayable the game is. The major issues I had were in the final two chapters of the game as while I loved the overall ending, the platforming sections picked up too much in the end and the final boss fight was not very intuitive when trying to figure out what to do with the cores.

Definetely one of the better games I've ever played. Fun, challenging puzzles and enjoyable co-op. Some puzzles took quite a long time for me to complete, but that's the point, and that made thinking up a solution much more satisfying. Interactive and loveable characters, and an ending that makes all the frustation some hard puzzles caused worth it to get to the end. Very good game.
